trans-unit.source: Defines a particular format for text, including font face, size, and style attributes.
This class cannot be inherited.
For more information about how to construct fonts, see [How to: Construct Font Families and Fonts](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/how-to-construct-font-families-and-fonts.md).
Windows Forms applications support TrueType fonts and have limited support for OpenType fonts.
If you attempt to use a font that is not supported, or the font is not installed on the machine that is running the application, the Microsoft Sans Serif font will be substituted.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that uses the specified existing <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle"></xref> enumeration.

For localized applications that are based on the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)] and earlier releases, specifying a font for `prototype` when that font has not been installed on the computer that is used to build your application will cause the Microsoft Sans Serif font to be used instead.
If your application depends on this behavior and you must recompile your application for the .NET Framework 3.0, you should specify the Microsoft Sans Serif font for `prototype`.
The existing <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> from which to create the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle"></xref> to apply to the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Multiple values of the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle"></xref> enumeration can be combined with the `OR` operator.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> using the specified size, style, unit, and character set.
The `gdiCharSet` parameter takes a value from the list defined in the Windows SDK header file WinGDI.h.
If the `familyName` parameter specifies a font that is not installed on the machine running the application or is not supported, Microsoft Sans Serif will be substituted.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontFamily"></xref> for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The em-size of the new font in the units specified by the unit parameter.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle"></xref> of the new font.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit"></xref> of the new font.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that specifies a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] character set to use for this font.
A Boolean value indicating whether the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> is derived from a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] vertical font.
emSize is less than or equal to 0, evaluates to infinity, or is not a valid number.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> using a specified size, style, unit, and character set.
The `gdiCharSet` parameter takes a value from the list defined in the Windows SDK header file WinGDI.h.

The em-size of the new font in the units specified by the unit parameter.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle"></xref> of the new font.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit"></xref> of the new font.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that specifies a
[!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] character set to use for this font.
A Boolean value indicating whether the new font is derived from a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] vertical font.
emSize is less than or equal to 0, evaluates to infinity, or is not a valid number.
family is `null`

The resulting font has its <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Style%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.FontStyle?displayProperty=fullName> and its <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName>.
Windows Forms applications support TrueType fonts and have limited support for OpenType fonts.
If the `familyName` parameter specifies a font that is not installed on the machine running the application or is not supported, Microsoft Sans Serif will be substituted.

The resulting font has its <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Style%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.FontStyle.Regular> and its <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit.Point>.

The em-size, in points, of the new font.

The style is set to <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Regular"></xref>.
The resulting font has its <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Style%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.FontStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.

emSize is less than or equal to 0, evaluates to infinity, or is not a valid number.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> is bold.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> is bold; otherwise, `false`.
Creates an exact copy of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> this method creates, cast as an <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Releases all resources used by this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Calling <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Dispose%2A> allows the resources used by this <xref:System.Drawing.Font> to be reallocated for other purposes.
Call <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Drawing.Font>.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Drawing.Font> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Drawing.Font> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Drawing.Font> was occupying.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
Always call <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Drawing.Font>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object's `Finalize` method.

Indicates whether the specified object is a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> and has the same <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.FontFamily"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.GdiVerticalFont"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.GdiCharSet"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.Style"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.Size"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.Unit"></xref> property values as this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The object to test.
`true` if the obj parameter is a and has the same , , , , , and property values as this ; otherwise, `false`.
Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.
Gets the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontFamily"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Drawing.FontFamily> represents a group of fonts that have a similar font face, but may have different sizes and styles (for example, Arial, Times New Roman, and Verdana).
The <xref href="System.Drawing.FontFamily"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> from the specified Windows handle to a device context.
For this method to work, the `hdc` parameter must contain a handle to a device context in which a font is selected.

This method will not work with an `hdc` handle acquired from a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object because the `hdc` handle does not have a font selected.
A handle to a device context.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> this method creates.
The font for the specified device context is not a TrueType font.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> from the specified Windows handle.
A Windows handle to a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] font.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> this method creates.
hfont points to an object that is not a TrueType font.
Creates a from the specified GDI logical font (LOGFONT) structure.
A [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] `LOGFONT`, or logical font, is a structure that contains 14 properties that describe a particular font.
For more information, see "The Logical Font" in the Windows Development documentation at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] `LOGFONT` structure from which to create the <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A handle to a device context that contains additional information about the lf structure.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that this method creates.
The font is not a TrueType font.
Creates a from the specified GDI logical font (LOGFONT) structure.
A [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] `LOGFONT`, or logical font, is a structure that contains 14 properties that describe a particular font.
For more information, see "The Logical Font" in the Windows Development documentation at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] `LOGFONT` structure from which to create the <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that this method creates.
Gets a byte value that specifies the GDI character set that this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> uses.

This property returns 1, unless a different character set is specified in the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Single%2CSystem.Drawing.FontStyle%2CSystem.Drawing.GraphicsUnit%2CSystem.Byte%29> constructor.
This property takes a value from the list defined in the Windows SDK header file WinGDI.h.
The character sets and byte values are listed in the following table.
Character set
Value
ANSI
DEFAULT
SYMBOL
SHIFTJIS
HANGEUL
HANGUL
CHINESEBIG5
OEM
JOHAB
HEBREW
ARABIC
GREEK
TURKISH
VIETNAMESE
THAI
EASTEUROPE
RUSSIAN
MAC
BALTIC
A byte value that specifies the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] character set that this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> uses.
The default is 1.
Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> is derived from a GDI vertical font.
Use this property to determine if a font is compatible with native Win32 controls on non-Unicode platforms.
<xref:System.Drawing.Font.GdiVerticalFont%2A> only returns `true` if this font was created from a classic GDI
font definition, like a LOGFONT or HFONT.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> is derived from a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] vertical font; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the hash code for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The hash code for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Returns the line spacing, in pixels, of this font.
The line spacing of a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text.
Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of the character itself.

If the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property of the font is set to anything other than <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName>, the height (in pixels) is calculated using the vertical resolution of the screen display.
For example, suppose the font unit is inches and the font size is 0.3.
Also suppose that for the corresponding font family, the em-height is 2048 and the line spacing is 2355.
For a screen display that has a vertical resolution of 96 dots per inch, you can calculate the height as follows:
The line spacing, in pixels, of this font.
Returns the line spacing, in the current unit of a specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref>, of this font.
The line spacing of a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text.
Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of the character itself.

If the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property of the font is set to anything other than <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName>, the height, in pixels, is calculated using the vertical resolution of the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object.
For example, suppose the font unit is inches and the font size is 0.3.
Also suppose that for the corresponding font family, the em-height is 2048 and the line spacing is 2355.

If the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object has a <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property value of <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName> and a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DpiY%2A> property value of 96 dots per inch, the height is calculated as follows:

Continuing with the same example, suppose the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object is set to <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName> rather than <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName>.
Then (using 1 inch = 25.4 millimeters) the height, in millimeters, is calculated as follows:
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that holds the vertical resolution, in dots per inch, of the display device as well as settings for page unit and page scale.
The line spacing, in pixels, of this font.
graphics is `null`.
Returns the height, in pixels, of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> when drawn to a device with the specified vertical resolution.

If the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property of the font is set to anything other than <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName>, the height (in pixels) is calculated using the vertical resolution of the screen display.
For example, suppose the font unit is inches and the font size is 0.3.
Also suppose that for the corresponding font family, the em-height is 2048 and the line spacing is 2355.
If the specified vertical resolution is 96 dots per inch, the height is calculated as follows:
The vertical resolution, in dots per inch, used to calculate the height of the font.
The height, in pixels, of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Gets the line spacing of this font.
The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text.
Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of the character itself.

If the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Unit%2A> property of the font is set to anything other than <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit?displayProperty=fullName>, the height (in pixels) is calculated using the vertical resolution of the screen display.
For example, suppose the font unit is inches and the font size is 0.3.
Also suppose that for the corresponding font family, the em-height is 2048 and the line spacing is 2355.
For a screen display that has a vertical resolution of 96 dots per inch, you can calculate the height as follows:
The value returned by the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.GetHeight%2A> method would be 33.11719, and the value returned by the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Height%2A> property would be 34.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Height%2A> property is the value returned by <xref:System.Drawing.Font.GetHeight%2A>, rounded up to the nearest integer.
The line spacing, in pixels, of this font.
Gets a value indicating whether the font is a member of <xref href="System.Drawing.SystemFonts"></xref>.
When the user changes the system font, the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.IsSystemFont%2A> property could return `true`, even if the font is not actually a system font.

To avoid this situation, if you are using system fonts in your application, you should track user preference changes by handling the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.UserPreferenceChanging> or <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.UserPreferenceChanged> event.
`true` if the font is a member of <xref href="System.Drawing.SystemFonts"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this font has the italic style applied.
`true` to indicate this font has the italic style applied; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the face name of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A string representation of the face name of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Gets the name of the font originally specified.
The actual font name and original font name can be different.
System requirements may cause the use of a font other than the font originally specified.
The string representing the name of the font originally specified.
Gets the em-size of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> measured in the units specified by the <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.Unit"></xref> property.
The em-size of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Gets the em-size, in points, of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The em-size, in points, of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> specifies a horizontal line through the font.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> has a horizontal line through it; otherwise, `false`.
Gets style information for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle"></xref> enumeration that contains style information for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Gets the name of the system font if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.IsSystemFont"></xref> property returns `true`.
The name returned by the <xref:System.Drawing.Font.SystemFontName%2A> property will be one of the members of the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts>, converted to a string.
The name of the system font, if <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.IsSystemFont"></xref> returns `true`; otherwise, an empty string ("").
Returns a handle to this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
When using this method, you must dispose of the resulting `Hfont` using the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] `DeleteObject` method to ensure the resources are released.
A Windows handle to this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The operation was unsuccessful.
Creates a GDI logical font (LOGFONT) structure from this .
This method sets the `logFont` parameter to the results of the font conversion.
For more information about logical fonts, see [LOGFONT structure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd145037.aspx).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to represent the `LOGFONT` structure that this method creates.
Creates a GDI logical font (LOGFONT) structure from this .
This method sets the `logFont` parameter to the results of the font conversion.
For more information about logical fonts, see [LOGFONT structure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd145037.aspx).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to represent the `LOGFONT` structure that this method creates.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that provides additional information for the `LOGFONT` structure.
graphics is `null`.
Returns a human-readable string representation of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The returned string has the following format:
[Font: Name=*fontName*, Size=*size*, Units=*units*, GDiCharSet=*gdiCharSet*, GdiVerticalFont=*boolean*]
A string that represents this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> is underlined.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> is underlined; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the unit of measure for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit"></xref> that represents the unit of measure for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data needed to serialize the target object.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination (see <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>) for this serialization.
